quests: Called to prophetic ministry in vision of God's throne (Isaiah 6)
Confronted kings Ahaz and Hezekiah with God's word
Prophesied judgment and restoration for Israel and Judah
Foretold the Babylonian exile and return
Revealed the Suffering Servant who would bear the sins of many
feats: Saw the LORD seated on His throne, high and exalted
Had his lips purified by a burning coal from the altar
Foretold Cyrus by name 150 years before his birth
Revealed the four Suffering Servant songs
Prophesied the New Heavens and New Earth

firstSong.text: Behold my servant, whom I uphold, my chosen, in whom my soul delights; I have put my Spirit upon him; he will bring forth justice to the nations.

secondSong.text: The LORD called me from the womb, from the body of my mother he named my name... He says: It is too light a thing that you should be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob; I will make you as a light for the nations, that my salvation may reach to the end of the earth.

thirdSong.text: I gave my back to those who strike, and my cheeks to those who pull out the beard; I hid not my face from disgrace and spitting.

fourthSong.hebrewText: הִנֵּה יַשְׂכִּיל עַבְדִּי יָרוּם וְנִשָּׂא וְגָבַהּ מְאֹד... וַיהוָה הִפְגִּיעַ בּוֹ אֵת עֲוֹן כֻּלָּנוּ
fourthSong.text: He was despised and rejected by men, a man of sorrows and acquainted with grief... Surely he has borne our griefs and carried our sorrows... He was pierced for our transgressions; he was crushed for our iniquities... The LORD has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

keyVerses.rejection: He was despised and rejected by men (53:3)
keyVerses.substitution: He was pierced for our transgressions (53:5)
keyVerses.silence: Like a lamb led to slaughter, he opened not his mouth (53:7)
keyVerses.death: They made his grave with the wicked (53:9)
keyVerses.exaltation: He shall see his offspring; he shall prolong his days (53:10)

virginBirth.hebrewText: הִנֵּה הָעַלְמָה הָרָה וְיֹלֶדֶת בֵּן וְקָרָאת שְׁמוֹ עִמָּנוּ אֵל
virginBirth.translation: Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
virginBirth.hebrewNotes: Almah (עַלְמָה) - young woman of marriageable age; Septuagint translates as parthenos (virgin)

childBorn.hebrewText: כִּי־יֶלֶד יֻלַּד־לָנוּ בֵּן נִתַּן־לָנוּ וַתְּהִי הַמִּשְׂרָה עַל־שִׁכְמוֹ
childBorn.translation: For to us a child is born, to us a son is given; and the government shall be upon his shoulder, and his name shall be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

branchOfJesse.hebrewText: וְיָצָא חֹטֶר מִגֵּזַע יִשָׁי וְנֵצֶר מִשָּׁרָשָׁיו יִפְרֶה
branchOfJesse.translation: There shall come forth a shoot from the stump of Jesse, and a branch (netzer) from his roots shall bear fruit.
branchOfJesse.hebrewNotes: Netzer (נֵצֶר) meaning 'branch' - connected to Nazarene/Nazareth wordplay

newHeavensEarth.translation: For behold, I create new heavens and a new earth, and the former things shall not be remembered.

quotations.text: The people dwelling in darkness have seen a great light

rabbinicTradition.readingOrder: Isaiah is read as Haftarah portions throughout the Jewish calendar year

description: Isaiah (Yeshayahu) is the greatest of the literary prophets, whose 66 chapters span themes of judgment, comfort, and redemption. His Suffering Servant songs in chapters 42-53 present the mysterious figure who bears the sins of many, central to both Jewish messianic expectation and Christian understanding of Jesus' atoning death. The Ethiopian eunuch's reading of Isaiah 53 led Philip to proclaim Jesus as the fulfillment of this prophecy.
